meanings.definition: A group of soldiers organized for a specific purpose
meanings.sent1: The brave brigade marched into battle together.
meanings.sent2: The rescue brigade quickly responded to the emergency call.
meanings.sent3: The cookie brigade was on a mission to deliver treats to everyone in town.
meanings.sent4: The brigade of ants worked tirelessly to carry food back to their nest.
meanings.sent5: The colorful uniforms of the brigade stood out against the green field.

meanings.definition: A group of people working together for a common cause
meanings.sent1: The volunteer brigade cleaned up the park every weekend.
meanings.sent2: The fundraising brigade collected donations for the local charity.
meanings.sent3: The laughter brigade entertained the audience with their jokes.
meanings.sent4: The gardening brigade transformed the empty lot into a beautiful garden.
meanings.sent5: The student brigade organized a successful school event.

meanings.definition: A unit of the army typically consisting of two or more regiments
meanings.sent1: The elite brigade was known for their exceptional combat skills.
meanings.sent2: The armored brigade was deployed to the front lines.
meanings.sent3: The dessert brigade was in charge of preparing delicious treats for the troops.
meanings.sent4: The medical brigade provided essential care to the wounded soldiers.
meanings.sent5: The reconnaissance brigade gathered crucial information behind enemy lines.
